originalTranscription: The ocean is made of ink, and I'm swimming through words that form and dissolve around me. Fish are punctuation marks darting between sentences. Ships sail on paragraphs that rewrite themselves mid-voyage. I try to read the water but the words keep changing, telling different stories each time I focus on them. A giant question mark whale surfaces, and when it speaks, its voice is the sound of uncertainty itself.
summary: An ocean of living text where words and stories are fluid, constantly rewriting themselves. The dreamer navigates this literary sea where meaning is never fixed and stories evolve unpredictably.

scenes.text: The ink ocean with words forming and dissolving, punctuation fish swimming between sentences, and ships sailing on self-rewriting paragraphs.
A massive question mark whale surfaces, its voice embodying the essence of uncertainty as the entire ocean of text shifts and changes.

fragments: The taste of words dissolving on the tongue.
The sound of a whale made of questions.
